org.gridlab.gat.security
Class SecurityContext

java.lang.Object
  org.gridlab.gat.security.SecurityContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CertificateSecurityContext, MyProxyServerCredentialSecurityContext, PasswordSecurityContext
public abstract class SecurityContext
extends Object
implements Cloneable

A container for security Information. Each context has a data object associated with it. The data object is opaque to the GAT API and is used and manipulated by adaptors based upon their interpretation of the context. A globus adaptor could store a GSI credential in it, while an SSH adaptor could store the private key in the data object.

Notes restrict the access to the context because it is a bad idea to broadcast passwords / credentials, so it is useful to restrict those to a set of hosts or adaptors.

removeDataObject

addNote

public final void addNote(String key,
                          String value)
Add notes to this context. Notes are used to give information to the adaptors. An example is addNote("host", "fs0.cs.vu.nl"), to indicate that this context is only valid for the machine above. Notes restrict and precise the usage of the authentication data. So an adaptor can verify in advance the usefulness of the authentication data for the host it want to access (e.g. for job submission). If no notes are defined, adaptors are allowed to use the context for any machine. If at least one note is defined, access is restricted to the adaptor/machine defined in the note(s) the set of notes known so far is:
"hosts", "hostname1:port1,hostname2:port2", where the port is optional
"adaptors", "adaptorName1,adaptorName2,..."
There may be more notes that are understood by a particular adaptor.

Parameters:
key - the name of the note
value - the value of the note

containsNoteKey

public final boolean containsNoteKey(String key)
Parameters:
key - the key to look for
Returns:
true if a note exists with the given key

getNoteValue

public final String getNoteValue(String key)
Parameters:
key - the key to look for
Returns:
the note attached to this key

isValidFor

public boolean isValidFor(String adaptorName,
                          String host,
                          int port)
This method checks the notes associated with this security context, and sees if the context is usable by a particular adaptor.

Parameters:
adaptorName - the name of the adaptor that wants to use this context
host - the destination hostname
port - the destination port
Returns:
true: the context is valid
